official-title.#text: To direct the Secretary of Education to award grants to States to pay the Federal share of carrying out full-day prekindergarten programs.

sponsor.#tail: introduced the following bill; which was referred to the

committee-name.#text: Committee on Education and the Workforce

short-title.#text: Expanded Access to Real Learning for our Young Act

text.#text: This Act may be cited as the

header.#text: Universal prekindergarten and early childhood education grant program

{http://namespaces.cato.org/catoxml}enti.@value: Expanded Access to Real Learning for our Young Act/s:2/ss:g

{http://namespaces.cato.org/catoxml}enti.#tail: is authorized to award grants, on a competitive basis, to States to pay the Federal share of carrying out full-day prekindergarten programs.

text.#text: From amounts appropriated under

{http://namespaces.cato.org/catoxml}enti.#tail: an application at such time, in such manner, and containing such information as the

text.#text: To receive a grant under this Act, a State shall submit to the
A State that receives a grant under this Act shall use such grant funds to carry out a prekindergarten program that, at a minimum—
if practicable, is located at a public school in the State or, if not practicable, is carried out by a private or other community-provider;

permits each 4-year-old child in the State to be voluntarily enrolled by the child’s parent in the prekindergarten program, and which is made available at no cost to families who make a combined income of up to 400 percent of the poverty line;
is a full-day program that runs the length of the regular school year;
maintains a maximum class size of 20 children, with at least 1 prekindergarten teacher per classroom;
ensures that the ratio of children to prekindergarten teachers and teacher aides does not exceed 10 to 1;
is taught by teachers who are paid a salary comparable to teachers of kindergarten through grade 12 at public schools in the State;
requires the State in which the program is located to determinate a minimum level of parental engagement in their child’s program; and
meets any other criteria that the

{http://namespaces.cato.org/catoxml}enti.#tail: shall give priority to States that will use the grants to carry out a prekindergarten program at a public school.

text.#text: In awarding grants under this section, the

{http://namespaces.cato.org/catoxml}enti.@value: Expanded Access to Real Learning for our Young Act/s:2/ss:c

text.#text: The Federal share of a grant under this Act shall not exceed 75 percent of the costs of carrying out the activities described in
Grant funds received under this Act shall be used to supplement and not supplant other Federal early childhood education funds in the State.

{http://namespaces.cato.org/catoxml}fund.#text: such sums as may be necessary for each of the fiscal years 2015 through 2019
